snippet: Obama administration lawyers said it would be lawful to kill a United States citizen who is a ranking figure in Al Qaeda and who poses “an imminent threat” against the country.
abstract: Unsigned and undated Justice Department 'white paper' obtained by NBC News offers Obama administration's lawyers'  views about lawfulness of killing, without trial, American citizen who executive branch officials decide is operational leader of Al Qaeda or one of its affiliates; is most detailed analysis yet to come into public view regarding issue.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and SCOTT SHANE

lead_paragraph: Obama administration lawyers said it would be lawful to kill a United States citizen who is a ranking figure in Al Qaeda and who poses “an imminent threat” against the country.

headline.seo: U.S. Memo Details Views on Killing Citizens in Al Qaeda
headline.main: Memo Cites Legal Basis for Killing U.S. Citizens in Al Qaeda
headline.print_headline: Legal Basis Cited to Kill Americans In Al Qaeda
